name: Hacienda Encantada Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So many mixed reviews on this resort and I can certainly understand why! Just returned a few days ago from a better than average all inclusive 5 night stay at HE with an obligatory time share tour(2.5 hrs). First, booked thru dream 2 travel and was left standing at the airport with NO transport as confirmed(in writing) and no reso at HE. Luckily I had an int'l phone- called HE and was told to show up at Marina Fiesta as HE was overbooked. Was re-imbursed for taxi(4 days later after badgering Lenin every day!).Room was old/ugly/Dinner at Lobster & Co. was excellent and included. I was persistant and demanded to be moved to HE the next day and was... First room was crap, bellman got us an EXCELLENT/ocean view room with big tub! The hotel turned out to be wonderful, all restaurant food and service was top notch and wonderful. Their reso administration is terribly disorganized and yet the property,all staff, view, cleanliness and facilities amply made up for the BS... Jeff the sales guy was reasonable but then got all winey and pissy when I said no for the 5th time. What do you want for $399 all inclusive for 2 unqualified time share crashers??? Quit complaining and recognize that it's 3ed world and cheap! I'd go back but book direct and if you get bumped to Marina Fiesta insist on being able to "day use all inclusive" at HE... The food choices at Marina Fiesta are better...
reviews.title: A mixed bag....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here twice... the first year was good. They were trying to make a great impression in hopes that we would buy a time share there. We got married in Cabo last year and spent two weeks in the area for our honeymoon. We stayed in 3 fabulous resorts and then the last 4 days at the HE. It was absolutely horrible. The food was bad. The service was bad. We saw a kid scrape his knee at the pool and the hotel charged the family for the band-aids! What!? They made us feel absolutely horrible for not buying a time share and the overall experience was just a nightmare. There are so many wonderful places in Cabo!! Do yourself a favor and pick something other than Hacienda Encantada.
reviews.title: Not a fan!

reviews.text: I just arrived home from a 7-day stay at Hacienda Encantada and was not impressed to say the least. I did my research before booking and read many reviews and it seemed like a good deal. My friend and I decided to go to the timeshare presentation on day 2, as we were promised $200 in spa coupons to do so. The presentation was not 1.5 hours as stated to us, it was closer to 2.5 hours which was cutting in to our vacation time. Our sales rep, DC, needs a class in customer service. He told us members do not like to hang out at the pool etc with non-members, which to me makes no sense. If you are a member and love the property why wouldn't you want to spread the word so others would buy? He said the reason we got such a great deal is because the Hacienda Encantada partners with Expedia to get people in for the sales promotion. He also said once you stay as a non-member you can never stay there again, unless ofcourse you buy. No worries, I would never want to stay again and/or recommend the resort to anyone.
reviews.title: Love Cabo, just not the resort!!

reviews.text: In the evening of day 2, I got severe food poisoning!! I had to get the on-call physician to come to my room and give me a shot to stop the vomiting. Sadly enough, this is one of the positives of the resort, the physician was there within 30 minutes and he did a wonderful job. The following day, we saw DC on the property and told him how sick I was the night before and his customer service skills were off again. He said oh it's just a little Montezuma's revenge, nothing a jump in 69 deg ocean won't fix, you had some "tainted" food. He never once asked if I was feeling better, etc. None of the employees seemed to care that they were serving "tainted" food, their response was, no one else has gotten sick. I have travelled to several countries and yes it does take some time for your body to adjust to new cuisine but this was true food poisoning (which was the physician's diagnosis).
reviews.title: First Class Resort

reviews.text: The resort itself is beautiful and very well maintained. It is perched on a sloping cliff and can be difficult to navigate. They do have golf carts to drive you around the resort, we opted to walk most of the time as we wanted the exercise. But for the elderly and those with any physical disabilitites it could be a bit challenging. Another positive, the guys that drive that carts are very friendly and helpful. I wish I could say more for the rest of the staff, but it just wasn't there and probably never will be.
reviews.title: No room at the Hacienda!

reviews.text: This was a timeshare exchange and we were very pleased with our experience. The staff is so helpful and professional. The resort has everything. It is a little out of Cabo San Lucas but there are shuttles for $5 each way or taxi are plentiful We would come back again.
reviews.title: First time to Cabo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are beautiful, be prepared to walk up and down steep hills and or stairs as you meander your way to the different locations. They do have carts that will take you to your destination if your timing is on.
reviews.title: Great if you like to just chill

reviews.text: It's very quiet, The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and the best fun is with the Activities Director.
reviews.title: My experience

reviews.text: The food at the restaurant is horrible! The poolside grill is definitely the place to eat when you go. On many occasions, we ditched the all inclusive and opted to go into town
reviews.title: Nothing negative to say!

reviews.text: The room was nice and clean except for the mold in the shower and there were a few places in the room where the paint was peeling.
reviews.title: Quiet Resort with Gorgeous Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a 5-day stay here through Groupon and it was wonderful. It is a timeshare property, but I never felt like they treated us any differently in terms of service, even though we were part of the Groupon package. Every staff member was very friendly and accomodating Our package included breakfast buffet every day (seriously the best I have had at a resort), a romantic dinner and a free bottle of wine. What a deal--this was the most affordable trip I've taken in awhile.
reviews.title: Great hospitality, removed from the hustle of Cabo San Lucas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You will be staying in Phase 2 if you aren't an owner, and most of the rooms do not have the amazing view...but really, who wants to stay in their room the whole time anyway? We had a ground level suite with a large patio next to the community area where they have the lightly-attended nightly activities. We had a sliver of a view, but it also felt very private and I just appreciated the ability to sit on a patio in the middle of March. So just know that you may not get an ocean view, but it's pretty easy to walk up to the restaurant or the pool and enjoy the view whenever you want. I didn't find the golf carts necessary or intrusive. If you really feel the need to skip the great exercise in walking to dinner, just start walking and one of the friendly drivers will find you and give you a lift. It's really not that far of a walk anywhere in the resort and I feel it just adds to the charm.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The timeshare people here are relentless, but everyone is trying sell you something in Cabo--just wait until you go downtown, it gets worse. Just be firm with them and you will be fine. We talked to someone who got stuck in a timeshare presentation for 3 hours, so I would advise against it.
reviews.title: Wonderful!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was not impressed with Cabo San Lucas itself--the beach was nice, but you can't relax when people are trying to sell you something every 5 minutes. There's a little bit of Spring Break action going on, but it didn't seem as out of control as I would have expected. The price-gouging in town is horrendous. I found the hotel had reasonable prices on food and drinks, and the little store had comparable prices to the grocery store where we stocked up before checking in. After going into town, we didn't feel the need to leave the resort. The only cons I can think of is the smoking around the pool is kind of irritating sometimes and transportation costs can add up, since the resort is removed from the airport and all the action. Great vacation and I definitely recommend Hacienda Encantada for anyone looking for relaxation and great service.
reviews.title: Heaven on earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort property is very beautiful. The infinity pool overlooking the Sea of Cortez was lovely. The weather during the day was perfect but it was a little cool and breezy at night. Our room was very spacious, comfortable and clean with a great view. The food at Las Marias was just average. Fernan, the activities director was great - so friendly and enthusiastic but not pushy at all - just a very warm and kind person. The whale watching excursion was well worth it!
reviews.title: Great vacation at Hacienda Encantada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at H.E from June 11th-June 18th 2011. We bought timeshare in 2008 and they were still building the property. They (the resort) did not even have a paved road at the time. They finally layed down a road from the highway to the resort. The gate at the entrance of the road is a beautiful picture and makes the guests feel very secure. My wife and and I stayed at phase 2 at the resort. The rooms in both phase 1 and phase 2 are almost identical,the only difference is that there are screens on the patio/balcony doors. The upkeep of the property is very beautiful,and you always see workers making the property even more beautiful. The views of the Sea of Cortez are beautiful and it always nice to see ships and boats from your balcony or while relaxing in the pool of Phase 1. The restaurants are beautiful, one is open air and the other is enclosed. You may want to ask for Miguel at the restaurant for service,he will go out of his way to make your dining experiences even more satisfying.Needless to say,all the staff do the best they can,the english language for some wait staff is not as good as others. You will be taken to your room via golf carts. They will come and get you from your room once you call the front desk. There is a theme night usually every night somewhere on the property, within walking distance from your room. You do not have to deal with a lot of noise in the wee hours of the night.(very quiet) Please be aware that the resort is about 15 min. from town but there is a shuttle that will take you to the marina or you can rent a car in the lobby. My wife and I love it and will return probably next year,unless we exchange with Interval International.Thumbs up for this resort,I'll be even more happy when they are finished bulding the rest of the property.
reviews.title: Total Relaxation

reviews.text: Just spent our second vacation at Hacienda Encantada. We are owners and decided to go back again rather thant trade through Interval International. As other's have said, the resort is breathtakingly beautiful. Rooms well appointed and views like no other. The oceanside pools are probably my favorite place on earth. Javier at the pool cafe and Fernan, the activities director are both very helpful and it was nice to see staff still there a year later. It's nice to see consistency. Fernan and Javier both go out of their way to be sure you have a wonderful stay no matter the request.
reviews.title: We Love it but they still have work to do

reviews.text: We opted this year to do the all inclusive package at a cost of $85.00 per person per day. Based on our poolside tabs for drinks and lunch, it was worth it.
reviews.title: Great rooms, great service, great time!

reviews.text: We only have a few suggestions for things they could work on or improve:
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: There is only one evening place to congregate and that was the outdoor Tequila bar and it closed at 10 and is not open every night. There were enough guests who wanted an evening place to hang out that it really should be open every night and probably open until midnight. It's a quiet resort and that's one of the things we love about it, but I don't think a few more hours at the tequila bar would change that. if you don't eat dinner until 8 or so and just want to wind down, it would be nice to have a place to do that somewhere and nothing is open past 10...which brings me to my second issue. Some of the "theme nights" like to try to shuffle guest out a bit early and wrap up. Advertised signs and things state that these events stay open until 10 or 11 but they often were wrapping up food and beverage as early as 9.
reviews.title: What a place
Absolutly Beautiful
reviews.text: We just returned from this Timeshare/Hotel. The property is breathtaking and the rooms are absolutly beautiful.. However!! some of the staff are in need of customer service training. If you traded from Interval International then you are put into the phase 2 location which has no ocean views at all but non the less beautiful. This is a very very quiet property and if you're looking for a party atmosphire then it's not the place for you.. I highly recommend this property for a relaxing vacation..

reviews.title: We had our wedding at HE and had the times of our lives!!!
reviews.text: Thank you so much to all the staff at Hacienda Encantada for making our wedding so special. We had 80 or so guests all staying at Hacienda and they all raved how wonderful everything was. The views were spectacular. The rooms were always kept super clean. Ana, our wedding coordinator, made sure everything ran smooth on our the wedding night. The staff gave us a gorgeous bouqet of flowers plus they surprised us by decorating our room with beautiful red rose petals the night of the wedding. We never wanted our trip to end. We loved HE and thought it was a perfect wedding venue!

reviews.title: Great service, view, food, internet access, pools creat a relaxing vacation!
reviews.text: My husband and I had a fantastic experience at the Hacienda Encantada. We had a master suite which included a huge deck with an awesome view. The service was friendly and efficient. The food at the pool restaurant as well as the Las Marias was fantastic everytime we ordered anything. The pools are gorgeous and very well maintained. We will return to this wonderful location between San Jose del Cabo and Cabo San Lucus. It is very close to Santa Maria beach which is a great place to snorkel.

reviews.title: Haven't left yet but already having bad experiences
reviews.text: We are planning to leave Saturday. We have run into several complications with the hotel. We were told by the hotel diff. prices for all inclusive and also our room was bigger than what it really is. A woman in reservations told me I was a liar today on the phone and the managers haven't been helpful at all. Marketing said they would give us the promised room only if we did the timeshare presentation. I explained that I already have a timeshare in Key West and that is how I had booked. through Interval. I am already disgusted with this resort and I haven't even gotten there. I hope that I can have a follow up review that when I get there things are better.

reviews.title: STUNNING VIEW BUT LACKS SOME CUTOMER SERVICE
reviews.text: Just got back from a 13 day stay at the stunningly gorgeous Hacienda Encantada.The grounds, rooms, pools and restaurants all have spectacular views of the ocean, ships, whales and the lights of Los Cabos at night. We had the all inclusive package but had to ask for almost everything from the stocking of our minibar to the refilling of a drink or cup of coffee. The customer service is just not there.My Fiancee was confronted by one of the El Patio staff for having more than the two towels and was demanding we turn the towels back because we had only two towel cards. I had to speak to 3 different people before I received a top floor room I had requested back in October. and the time share presentation was brutal and relentless. It is hard to say anything negative about this resort because of its beauty, but we are accustomed to better service, better alcohol choices and not having to ask for everything with an all inclusive package. There are a few employees that go out of their way, Jesus and Moroni at Las Marias, and Margarita, our house keeper. Most are trying but not giving that extra effort that makes you say WOW. The high lights of our stay were hanging out at the infinity pool during the day and watching the sunset at Las Marias at night. . We would love to go back but would have to be assured of better service. The Phase 1 pool is quiet but the Phase 2 is not, repetitive 80's and 90's soft rock at the Phase 2 pool during the day echoes off the pool to your room. Overall this resort has a lot of potential and will have even better views and facilities when it is completed.It just needs a little help with its customer service.

We had 2 families totaling 8 people stay in a 2-bedroom 3 full bath suite in Phase 1 from June 18-29. We had comfortable accommodations and did not feel cramped in at all. In fact, it's very spacious, the biggest suite we've stayed in. We especially love the beautiful room decorations which reminds us we are in Mexico, not in a "modern" hotel room. We are owners since 2007 and we saw some additions to the resort. The new entrance is gorgeous and grand and the paved road was a welcome surprise! We arrived late at night but the staff from the valet/bell boys to the reception staff made it easy for us to get into our room to get our much needed rest. We woke up to great views of the ocean and we started the day getting a few stuff at the mini-market on the first floor to make breakfast. Later we walked around the resort to familiarize ourselves with the additions. They have a small spa that I did not use this time so I cannot comment on it. They also have a small "temporary" gym in Phase II. I was later told by sales staff that construction of the 20,000 sq. ft. spa/gym overlooking the ocean will start in 6 months and be completed 18 months later. I asked about a bbq grill and they said phase III will have lots of bbq grills. They also said they are trying to get a beach area in front of the resort but there has been lots of oppositions to this - I hope to see this materialize in the near future. I was also glad to see a laundry room so we don't have to pack so much clothes. It cost $4 each wash/dry and you bring/buy your own soap/softener. They had a great kid's area in phase II with a water park, playground, wading pool. My neice and nephews ages 4,5 and 7 had a blast! My sister and brother in law, who spent their first time here, said the pictures online does not do justice to how beautiful and breathtaking HE is! My sister said she this place is AMAZING! We all attended the Tuesday Night Social that starts at 6 p.m. You must go to this. They had free drinks and appetizers, shows, and games with prizes. Later, my sister and I played blackjack for prizes. We had a great time! Speaking of a great time, the activities coordinator Fernand is wonderful! He went around greeting everyone and encourages people to join their activities. He was great with the kids. My nephews Bryce and Ryland liked him so much, Bryce went to the store and offered Fernand some of his Twix chocolate bar. Thank you Fernand for putting lots of smiles and laughter on our faces! We also like that they have entertainment almost every night. I didn't get his name but the entertainer who sings almost every night at phase II reminds me of my dad so he was soooo wonderful. They also have themed entertainment at night which I was very happy to see. All in all, we had a wonderful experience and can't wait to come back. The staff were very nice and are happy to assist us. The grounds are well-kept.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back....
Solid Timeshare
reviews.text: We traded through Interval for this resort. We were a little worried because we were in Cabo for 2 weeks. The first week we stayed at CaboVillas which is right in the heart of Cabo. Once we realized how far away this resort was from the heart of Cabo we became a little concerned. They have a shuttle but the last trip back from downtown is at 8:30 so if you want to go out you need to plan on a high priced cab ride back. The resort is gorgeous, nice furniture & friendly staff. Very high end resort. I would recommend staying here if you want a solid timeshare with great views & you aren't interested in much of the downtown Cabo experience.

Stayed here in February, 2011 with some friends while in Cabo for a fishing trip. The resort is very nice. The suites are beautiful and many have spectacular views. The pools are also fantastic. The resort is still under construction. It has only one restaurant, which was just fair. The place was unbeleivably quiet. If you want to party, this is not the place for you. If you want to relax, you will enjoy this resort. There are some great restaurants in Cabo. My favorit was the Cabo Cantina. If you want to go fishing, I strongly recommend the Bob Marlin, owned by Jerry. I did a separate review of our fantastic two days of fishing.
reviews.title: Nice, Quiet Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend this resort, especially if you are a bit tired of the downtown Cabo scene. It was clean and modern while still maintaining a classic Mexican feel.
reviews.title: Charming and Relaxing

reviews.text: What I loved:
reviews.title: What a great value overall. Wonderful staff, room and food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First let me say that I truly love Los Cabos and this resort helped me fall even more in love with it!
reviews.title: Loved Hacienda Encantada!

reviews.text: The entrance to the resort is absolutely gorgeous including the drive up to the lobby. The security is tight and make you feel extremely safe at all times! The valet service/cart operators are VERY friendly and are always available to assist you in any way. They are gems!
reviews.title: Just returned from our second trip to Hacienda Encantada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check -in/concierge area is truly beautiful and the furniture is just incredible! Upon check-in, we were taken care of by a very sweet young woman (can't remember her name, blonde and very pretty) and she made every single charge ($7 daily for maid service and "behind the scene" workers and $11 daily for Interval vacationers) known. I knew EXACTLY what my bill was going to be like at the end of the trip and it was a wonderful experience. Also, Interval gave a $100 credit to my bill. Not sure why but I DEFINITELY did NOT complain! So many others upon check-out did not have such an agreeable experience which was unfortunate.
reviews.title: Beautiful, but very Quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was just stunning!!! We stayed in a one bedroom villa with two bathrooms, dining area, kitchen, living room and GORGEOUS king size bedroom. Pictures really don't do it justice at all! The patio was ENORMOUS and made for some very relaxing evenings.
reviews.title: Very Relaxing, beautiful resort!

reviews.text: The pools and grounds are beautiful and the stunning view of the waves crashing on the rocks will forever be etched in our minds.
reviews.title: TIMESHARE PRESSURE EVEN WHEN YOU ARE THERE ON YOUR OWN DIME!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The tranquility, service and rooms are amazing, the view is priceless, stayed with friends in December and it was so quiet and peaceful at the pool... Heading back next month....I highly recommend this if you are looking for one of the best vacations ever
reviews.title: A beautiful escape

reviews.text: Super clean. Good service. A bit boring and remote. But nice amenities with spa, , hot tubs, pool, bars. Didn't seem crowded even though at full capacity. One thing that's true here just like elsewhere in Mexico....they are bureaucratic and have lots of silly rules. But nobody is empowered to make a decision outside the norm. Constantly being told "that's the rules mam, I cannot help you". Frustrating!
reviews.title: Didn't disappoint.
beware of bogus charges on bill
reviews.text: We traded our timeshare through Interval International for Hacienda Encantada and paid the normal exchange fee. Upon checking out from the resort, there was a line item for about $11/day claiming to be an Interval International surcharge. We had never seen this before and couldn't reach Interval while in Mexico.When we returned home we found out that this was not an Interval charge but a charge from the resort. We are reversing the charge through Visa. Beware of this false charge if you traded to come here.

What a gorgeous, luxurious resort! Resort is beautifully decorated with artwork from Guadalajara, Mexico. Excellent service - especially from the activities director, Fernan. They had a yummy chicken mole and a wonderful Mexican assortment platter dish. (Watch out for overcooked seafood.) Free horseback riding in the cactus desert on Fridays, for the all inclusive plan. If you are looking for a quiet relaxing vacation, this is the place for you!
reviews.title: Gorgeous resort!

reviews.text: This is the WOW factor with stunning groundkeeping, beautiful rooms, and amazing service and personnel. I've always looked at photos on hotel websites, but never found them to be the same in person. This one is even better than the photos. The personnel (as well as the local people through Cabo) were very friendly and helpful. We had especially great service from Francisco, bell boy at the Hacienda Encantada. A side note - the scuba diving was fantastic. It was colder than we expected, and not as good visibility in February, but we have never seen more sealife than at Cabo. Just take the advise of the dive shops and wear a heavier wet suit (7.5mil worked great for us) and hoods, gloves, and boots. You will stay comfortable throughout the dive.
reviews.title: Scuba diving trip - 1st time in Cabo

description: Unique and breathtakingly beautiful, this spectacular Contemporary Hacienda style Luxury All Inclusive resort located on the Tourist Corridor in Cabo San Lucas offers magnificent panoramic views to the Sea of Cortes, romantic settings, distinctive dining, spacious and luxurious accommodations, and a variety of venues for special events. Your will be amazed of the bright, terracotta colored, Mexican Hacienda style buildings that are beautifully decorated with handmade Talavera tile murals, vases, classical sculptures, Spanish colonial fountains, contemporary art for contrast, and upscale traditional Mexican furnishing, driving them to experience an authentic Mexican ambiance throughout their stay.
